For the sketch, create a face and a single loop (loop\\_1) consisting of four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4). The lines have the following start and end points: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.525, 0.5562] - line\\_3: [0.525, 0.5562] to [0.225, 0.5562] - line\\_4: [0.225, 0.5562] to [0.0, 0.0] The loop forms a rectangle inclined at an angle, with a length of 0.75 units and a width of approximately 0.6 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the scaled sketch by 0.6 units in the direction of the normal, creating a three-dimensional rectangular prism. The height of this prism is 0.75 units, the width is approximately 0.6 units, and the length is 0.75 units. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side.** Create a new coordinate system with Euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.2826, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch, create a face and a single loop (loop\\_1) consisting of four lines (line\\_1 through line\\_4). The lines have the following start and end points: - line\\_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.1899, 0.0] - line\\_2: [0.1899, 0.0] to [0.1899, 0.0879] - line\\_3: [0.1899, 0.0879] to [0.0, 0.0879] - line\\_4: [0.0, 0.0879] to [0.0, 0.0] The loop forms a rectangle inclined at an angle, with a length of approximately 0.19 units and a width of 0.6 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1899. Perform a cut extrusion of the scaled sketch to a depth of 0.6 units in the opposite direction of the normal, effectively creating a sloped side on the prism from part 1. The height, width, and length of this new prism remain the same as the original prism.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.2143, 0.0726, 0.1071]. 2. **Create the first face of the sketch**. This face is a rectangle with the following lines: * Line 1: Start point is [0.0, 0.0], end point is [0.2143, 0.0] * Line 2: Start point is [0.2143, 0.0], end point is [0.2143, 0.1607] * Line 3: Start point is [0.2143, 0.1607], end point is [0.0, 0.1607] * Line 4: Start point is [0.0, 0.1607], end point is [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2143. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D space**. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along its normal direction by 0.0335 units and in the opposite direction by 0.0335 units. This will create the 3D model of the rectangular prism. Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a metallic tube. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. Set the Euler angles to [90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.2143, 0.1181, 0.1688]. 2. **Create the first face of the sketch**. This face is a circle with the following properties: * Center is [0.0455, 0.0455] * Radius is 0.0455 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.0911. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D space**. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along its normal direction by 0.2143 units and in the opposite direction by 0 units. This will create the 3D model of the cylinder. Part 3 Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top edge. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.4286, 0.0726, 0.1071]. 2. **Create the first face of the sketch**. This face is a shape with the following properties: * Arc 1: Start point is [0.0, 0.0964], mid point is [0.1678, 0.0718], end point is [0.3214, 0.0] * Arc 2: Start point is [0.3214, 0.0], mid point is [0.1797, 0.1183], end point is [0.0, 0.1607] * Line 1: Start point is [0.0, 0.1607], end point is [0.0, 0.0964] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3214. 4. **Transform the 2D sketch into 3D space**. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along its normal direction by 0.0335 units and in the opposite direction by 0.0335 units. This will create the 3D model of the rectangular prism with a curved top edge.</description>
